data.title: Event Details
data.text:
TC NATIONALS

July 15-18, 2024 | Chino Hills, CA

2024 will mark the 13th year of the TC Nationals. We are excited to announce that the event will return to Southern California. This event is a genuine testing ground for the most talented and organized club programs in the nation!

Fields by Age Division:

​18U Division:

Chino Hills Community Park, BLD Chino Hills, West Covina Sportsplex

16U Division:

Rosetta Canyon, BLD Perris

14U Division:

BLD Riverside

Teams will NOT be officially entered in the tournament until the following registration requirements are met:

Entry fee paid in full

Minimum of 30 total room nights (ex: 6 rooms for 5 nights) with a Triple Crown Lodging Partner, booked inside of the TC Nationals block. Teams will receive a team booking link after they pay for the tournament. Once you have booked your rooms using your team booking link, you do NOT need to report your rooms on the Triple Crown Website. We will keep track of where teams are staying through your specific booking link.

A completed Triple Crown digital roster

Reported team insurance

​

Game Times Available: One week prior to the event.​

Format: 2 pool games that seed everyone into a double elimination bracket (multiple doubles in each age division). Then every team will go into a single elimination bracket with teams who finished like them in the double elimination bracket.

Monday July 15

Games start at 8am. 2 pool play games for each team and these games will seed you into the bracket. All pool games are 1 hr 45 minutes, no new inning.

Tuesday July 16

Double elimination bracket, All bracket games are a full 7 innings, no time limit.

Wednesday July 17

Double elimination bracket finishes

Single elimination brackets start

Thursday July 18

Championship day

2024 will mark the 13th year of the TC Nationals event -- we are thrilled to announce our return to the fastpitch hotbed of Southern California.

The TC Nationals debuted in 2012 in grand style with 60 teams. New York City played host to the inaugural gathering of the nation's top fastpitch teams (based on the US Club Rankings). In 2013, 120 teams battled for the TC National Championship in Reno/Tahoe. In 2014, the Georgia towns of Cumming, Alpharetta and Gainesville played host and welcomed 186 teams. In 2015, 184 teams went to Reno/Tahoe.

​In 2016, the top teams went back to NYC to compete and in 2017 TC partnered with Austin, TX, "The Live Music Capital of the World" for another successful event. The 2018 and 2019 events were held in Alpharetta and Cumming, GA with the top 144 teams in the country. The 2020 TC Nationals event took place regionally with elite brackets in Southeast Nationals (Georgia) and Southwest Nationals (Texas). Triple Crown then headed west for the 2021 and 2022 events, with the action taking place in and around Chino Hills and Riverside, CA.

2023 Champions (Georgia, 179 teams, TC Nationals combined with SE Nationals):

18u -- Lady Dukes Lamar

16u -- Virginia Unity Johnson/Ross

14u -- Indiana Magic National Gold Bennett/Goddard
